item.title: South Africa vs Pakistan Match Prediction - Who will win today’s 3rd T20I match between SA vs PAK? - CricTracker
item.description:
South Africa vs Pakistan Match Prediction - Who will win today’s 3rd T20I match between SA vs PAK?

Publication Date: December 14, 2024

Source: CricTracker

South Africa has emerged victorious in the first two matches of the ongoing T20I series against Pakistan, leading to a highly anticipated 3rd T20I clash, which is set to take place at the Wanderers Stadium in Johannesburg.

  • South Africa defeated Pakistan in the first two T20Is of the series.
  • Captain Mohammad Rizwan of Pakistan needs to step up for his team’s success.
  • Notable performances from South Africa include David Miller, Reeza Hendricks, and Rassie van der Dussen.
  • The match will be held on December 14, at 9:30 PM IST.
  • The pitch at Wanderers Stadium favors batters, with a good total considered to be above 200 runs.
“South Africa to win the match” - Today's Match Prediction

The competition promises high excitement as both teams vie for dominance in this tight series, with South Africa favored to continue their winning streak.

item.title: Vinod Kambli Responds After Kapil Dev Offers To Help Him: "Have No Hesitation..." | Cricket News - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Vinod Kambli Responds After Kapil Dev Offers To Help Him: "Have No Hesitation..."

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

Vinod Kambli, the former Indian cricketer, is set to enter rehab following a financial and health crisis, with support from notable cricket figures including Kapil Dev and Sunil Gavaskar.

  • Kambli has agreed to enter rehab, acknowledging his previous 14 attempts.
  • Kapil Dev offered to cover treatment costs on the condition that Kambli agrees to rehabilitate.
  • Sunil Gavaskar has also extended help and support to Kambli.
  • Kambli stated he has no hesitation about going to rehab, crediting his wife for managing their financial situation.
  • His only income currently comes from a BCCI pension of Rs 30,000 per month.
  • Other former cricketers, including Ajay Jadeja and Abey Kuruvilla, have reached out to Kambli for support.
"Bad (on his financial condition). But the manner in which my wife has handled everything, hats off to her. ... Sure, I have no hesitation (to enter rehab), because until I have my family with me, I'm not afraid of anything, anybody." - Vinod Kambli

Kambli expressed optimism about his situation, believing that the BCCI would help him if needed. His recent public appearance raised concerns about his condition, and he is grateful for the support from his peers.

item.title: 'Really surprised': Matthew Hayden reacts to Rohit's bold decision on Day 1 of Gabba Test - The Times of India
item.description:
'Really surprised': Matthew Hayden reacts to Rohit's bold decision on Day 1 of Gabba Test

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

Former Australian opener Matthew Hayden expressed surprise at Rohit Sharma's bold decision to bowl first on the opening day of the Gabba Test, given that the pitch conditions seemed more suited for batting.

  • Hayden was taken aback by Rohit's toss decision, stating that the pitch favored batters.
  • He noted that the groundsman had likely prepared the pitch earlier due to recent rain, affecting its behavior.
  • India's bowlers struggled against Australia, who ended the day at 28/0 in 13.2 overs.
  • Hayden believes that the pitch will deteriorate over the next couple of days, making spinners more effective.
“I was really surprised that actually, Rohit won the toss and decided to bowl, because I felt like it was over-prepared... Almost 12 inches of rain in the past two weeks." - Matthew Hayden

In conclusion, Hayden emphasized that opting to bat first would have been a wiser choice, considering the expected changes in pitch conditions over the course of the match.

item.title: Viswanathan Anand Responds As Ex-World Champion Criticises D Gukesh's Title Triumph - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Viswanathan Anand Responds As Ex-World Champion Criticises D Gukesh's Title Triumph

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

Legendary chess player Viswanathan Anand promised support for D. Gukesh, who faced criticism regarding his World Championship victory over Ding Liren. Anand emphasized that criticism is part of achieving success and praised Gukesh's historic triumph.

  • D. Gukesh becomes the youngest chess world champion by defeating Ding Liren.
  • Critiques from former champion Vladimir Kramnik question the quality of the match.
  • Magnus Carlsen also criticizes the earlier rounds, calling them uncharacteristic for World Championship contenders.
  • Anand advises Gukesh to ignore the criticism and reflects on the importance of his achievement.
  • Anand highlights Gukesh's strong performance in recent competitions leading to his championship win.
"To be honest, I think it just comes with the territory. You ignore it and that's all." - Viswanathan Anand

In conclusion, Anand views Gukesh's victory as a significant milestone in Indian chess, celebrating the new generation's achievements despite the surrounding criticism.

item.title: There is a younger ‘world champion’ than D Gukesh: The story of Ukraine's forgotten chess prodigy Ruslan Ponomariov - Hindustan Times
item.description:
There is a younger ‘world champion’ than D Gukesh: The story of Ukraine's forgotten chess prodigy Ruslan Ponomariov

Publication Date: Dec 14, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Former FIDE champion Ruslan Ponomariov, who won his title in 2002, is often overshadowed by D Gukesh, the current undisputed youngest world champion. This article explores the historical context and implications of their respective victories.

  • Ponomariov became the FIDE World Champion in 2002 at just 18 years old, making him the youngest to do so at the time.
  • The chess world saw a split between the classical title and the FIDE title from 1993 to 2006, leading to two recognized champions.
  • D Gukesh became the youngest undisputed FIDE world champion at 18 years and six months.
  • Ponomariov's victory is often not recognized as Undisputed, which is key for the title debate.
  • Despite the split, Ponomariov continued to have a successful career, remaining active in high-level competitions.
“Ever since 1993, there have been two titles, the phoney one controlled and organised by FIDE and the real one organised outside FIDE’s control.” - IM David Levy

In summary, while D Gukesh is officially recognized as the youngest world champion, Ruslan Ponomariov's achievement in a challenging format highlights the complexities of chess titles during a divided era in the sport.

item.title: 'Nahi ho raha swing' - Jasprit Bumrah's frustration an early worry for India in Gabba Test - The Times of India
item.description:
Nahi ho raha swing - Jasprit Bumrah's frustration an early worry for India in Gabba Test

Publication Date: [Insert Date] Source: Times of India

In the third Test against Australia at the Gabba, Indian captain Rohit Sharma opted to bowl first under cloudy conditions. However, Jasprit Bumrah expressed his frustration over the lack of swing during the early overs.

  • Rohit Sharma chose to bowl first despite expectations of a favorable pitch for fast bowlers.
  • Bumrah was heard on the stump microphone saying, "Nahin ho raha swing aise bhi; kahin bhi kar lo", indicating the ball was not swinging.
  • The first day was disrupted by rain, with only 13.2 overs bowled, leaving Australia at 28 for 0 by the end.
  • Indian bowlers experimented with different lines but failed to get swing or seam movement.
  • Former players and commentators expressed concerns about the decision to bowl first at the Gabba, citing historical context.
"You bat at the Gabba. If you face Australia, you want them to bat second and fourth." - Kerry O'Keeffe

This situation highlights ongoing challenges for India in the Test series and raises questions about their bowling strategy in conditions that did not provide the expected advantages.

item.title: 'Nahi ho raha...': Jasprit Bumrah's anguish caught on stump mic before rain crashes Day 1 of India vs Australia 3rd Test - Hindustan Times
item.description:
'Nahi ho raha...': Jasprit Bumrah's anguish caught on stump mic before rain crashes Day 1 of India vs Australia 3rd Test

Publication Date: Dec 14, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Rain disrupted Day 1 of the third Test between India and Australia at the Gabba, allowing only 13.2 overs of play. The highlight was a moment captured on the stump mic featuring Jasprit Bumrah expressing his frustration.

  • Rohit Sharma won the toss and opted to bowl first under overcast conditions.
  • Jasprit Bumrah struggled to find swing and indicated to Shubman Gill during play that the ball wasn't swinging as expected.
  • Usman Khawaja and Nathan McSweeney faced the Indian bowlers comfortably, contributing to Australia's score of 28/0 before rain halted play.
  • The play is scheduled to resume with adjusted timings at 5:20 AM IST, contingent on weather conditions.

“Nahi ho raha swing aise bhi (The ball isn't swinging),” Jasprit Bumrah expressed to Shubman Gill after his delivery.

As both teams prepare for the resumption, memories of India's historic win at the Gabba in 2020-21 loom large, with Rishabh Pant sharing his positive outlook about returning to the venue.

item.title: Exclusive | Meet Matthew Hayden's daughter Grace who loves dal, is a big fan of Rishabh Pant - The Times of India
item.description:
Exclusive | Meet Matthew Hayden's daughter Grace who loves dal, is a big fan of Rishabh Pant

Publication Date: (Date Not Provided) | Source: Times of India

Matthew Hayden's daughter, Grace, shares her love for India and cricket, particularly highlighting her admiration for cricketer Rishabh Pant amid a rain-interrupted Test match in Brisbane.

  • Only 13.2 overs were played on the opening day of the third India-Australia Test due to heavy rain.
  • Grace Hayden enjoys Indian cuisine, particularly dal curry and roti, thanks to her father's influence.
  • She names Rishabh Pant as her favorite cricketer and admires his inspiring comeback story after a serious car accident.
  • Grace believes that despite players' familiarity through the IPL, national pride prevails when playing for one's country.
  • She predicts Australia will win the remaining Tests in the series, which is currently tied at 1-1.
"His comeback story has been sensational... he's definitely an inspiring player," said Grace about Rishabh Pant.

The ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy has generated significant interest, with Grace optimistic about Australia's chances despite a rain-affected start to the match.

item.title: Now Physically Weak, Vinod Kambli Was Once Super Fit As Virat Kohli & Jadeja, Here's A Proof: Watch - News18
item.description:
Now Physically Weak, Vinod Kambli Was Once Super Fit As Virat Kohli & Jadeja, Here's A Proof: Watch

Publication Date: December 14, 2024, 14:57 IST

Vinod Kambli’s deteriorating health has raised concerns among fans following his recent frail appearance at a memorial event in Mumbai. An old video from 1994 showcasing a fit Kambli has surfaced, contrasting his current condition.

  • An old 1994 video shows a young, athletic Vinod Kambli endorsing a glucose supplement.
  • The 1983 World Cup-winning team, led by Kapil Dev, has offered to help Kambli, but only if he seeks rehabilitation.
  • Kambli has expressed willingness to enter rehab to improve his health.
“We can’t look after him if he does not want to look after himself," - Kapil Dev.
“I’m ready to go for rehab. I want to go there because I don’t fear anything. My family is with me," - Vinod Kambli.

The contrasting imagery of Kambli's past athleticism and his current struggles highlights the importance of support and self-care in overcoming personal challenges.

item.title: FIDE reacts to ‘deliberately lost’ allegations on Gukesh vs Ding World Championship final, counters Carlsen, Kramnik - Hindustan Times
item.description:
FIDE reacts to ‘deliberately lost’ allegations on Gukesh vs Ding World Championship final, counters Carlsen, Kramnik

Date: Dec 14, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Amid heavy criticism from former World Champions regarding the quality of the Gukesh vs Ding World Championship final, FIDE President Arkady Dvorkovich stated that mistakes in sports are natural and should not be attributed to players of such high caliber.

  • FIDE President Arkady Dvorkovich commented on the criticism regarding the players' performance in the final, stating that mistakes are an inherent part of sports.
  • Defending champion Ding made a critical error in the final match, leading to an unexpected victory for 18-year-old Gukesh.
  • Former champion Vladimir Kramnik criticized Ding's mistake, labeling it "childish" and calling for an investigation.
  • Kramnik expressed disappointment over the match quality, calling it "the end of chess as we know it."
  • Magnus Carlsen also questioned the standard of play, stating it resembled early rounds of an open tournament.
  • Viswanathan Anand advised Gukesh to ignore criticism, emphasizing that it accompanies success.
"Sports is about mistakes, without mistakes, there would be no goals in football. Every sportsman makes mistakes but that's what we are excited about, whether the opponent can find the way to use a mistake." - Arkady Dvorkovich

The ongoing debate highlights the intense scrutiny faced by young champions like Gukesh and the differing opinions within the chess community regarding the evolving standards of the game.

item.title: Vinod Kambli earns more pension than Yuvraj Singh, star all-rounder gets only Rs 22500, while Kambli earns Rs... - India.com
item.description:
Vinod Kambli earns more pension than Yuvraj Singh, star all-rounder gets only Rs 22500, while Kambli earns Rs...

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: India.com

Vinod Kambli and Yuvraj Singh, both retired cricket players, receive different pensions from BCCI, with Kambli earning significantly more despite his financial challenges.

  • Yuvraj Singh receives a pension of ₹22,500 from the BCCI post-retirement.
  • Vinod Kambli earns ₹30,000 as a pension, which is his sole source of income.
  • Kambli's cricket career spanned from 1991 to 2000, playing in 17 Tests and 104 ODIs.
  • Yuvraj Singh had a successful career from 2000 to 2017, known for his contributions to India's T20 and ODI World Cup victories.
"According to media reports, Vinod Kambli, who has no savings, relies completely on his pension from the BCCI."

This stark difference in pension highlights the varying financial situations of retired athletes, underscoring the necessity for better financial planning and support for sports professionals after retirement.

item.title: Australia’s booing crowd should know Mohammed Siraj’s back story - The Indian Express
item.description:
Australia’s booing crowd should know Mohammed Siraj’s back story

Publication Date: December 2024

Source: The Indian Express

Mohammed Siraj showcased his determination in a recent match despite facing challenges during his performance against Australia, emphasizing his potential as a key player.

  • Siraj took his first wicket after 21 overs in the second Test at Adelaide.
  • He achieved figures of 4/98 in 24.4 overs during the match.
  • Throughout his initial overs, Siraj displayed impressive pace and rhythm but struggled to secure wickets.
  • His performance characterized by a mix of frustration and charm highlighted his amateurish yet endearing style.
“Siraj would look exasperated, he would wipe the sweat on his face with his untucked shirt. There has always been something charmingly amateurish about Siraj.”

Siraj's story serves as a reminder of the challenges athletes face and the perseverance required to succeed in competitive sports.

item.title: India drop Reddy; Kashyap, Bist, Rawal get maiden call-ups for West Indies series - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
India drop Reddy; Kashyap, Bist, Rawal get maiden call-ups for West Indies series

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Opener Shafali Verma continues to miss out from both squads after being dropped for the ODIs against Australia, and several new players have been called up for the upcoming West Indies series.

  • D Hemalatha out from the T20I squad, Radha Yadav misses out in ODIs despite being the highest wicket-taker against New Zealand.
  • Injuries keep Yastika Bhatia, Shreyanka Patil, and Priya Punia off the squad.
  • Nandini Kashyap, Raghvi Bist, and Pratika Rawal receive their first call-ups.
  • Kashyap was the top scorer for Uttarakhand with 247 runs in the Senior Women's T20 Trophy.
  • Bist impressed with consistent performances in domestic cricket and India A series.
  • Rawal made headlines with an unbeaten 161 runs in a domestic one-day match.
  • The West Indies series consists of three T20Is and three ODIs starting December 15.
"Reddy has been left out of the squad despite finishing as India's joint-highest wicket-taker in the T20 World Cup, with seven wickets in four games."

The West Indies series marks an important opportunity for emerging players, while notable performers like Reddy will continue to play in domestic tournaments to regain their spots.

item.title: Convincing Afghanistan win levels Zimbabwe T20 series - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Convincing Afghanistan win levels Zimbabwe T20 series

Date: Dec 13, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Afghanistan secured a 50-run victory against Zimbabwe, leveling their T20 series with one match left to play.

  • Darwish Rasooli scored his first international fifty with 58 runs.
  • Naveen-ul-Haq and Rashid Khan each took three wickets, contributing to Zimbabwe's total of 103 runs.
  • Afghanistan posted 153-6 in their innings, with key contributions from Azmatullah Omarzai and Gulbadin Naib.
  • The teams will meet again at Harare Sports Club for the final match of the series.
"We are still struggling to establish a strong top order, but the way Darwish played was very impressive," said Afghanistan captain Rashid.
"Our Achilles heel was once again our batting. We are still struggling to post good totals consistently," remarked Zimbabwe captain Raza.

Afghanistan's upcoming match will be critical as they look to win the series against Zimbabwe, who have shown promise but need to improve their batting consistency.

item.title: Vinod Kambli says he commented against Sachin in frustration, ‘ready to go to rehab’ - ThePrint
item.description:
Vinod Kambli says he commented against Sachin in frustration, 'ready to go to rehab'

Publication Date: New Delhi

Source: The article discusses Vinod Kambli's health struggles and relationship with Sachin Tendulkar.

For the first time, former India cricketer Vinod Kambli has openly shared his health issues and his complex relationship with childhood friend Sachin Tendulkar, highlighting support received during his tough times.

  • Kambli revealed his health struggles, including a severe urine infection and a recent collapse.
  • He expressed frustration leading to earlier comments about Sachin, clarifying he has always been supported by him.
  • Kambli credited Sachin for paying for two of his surgeries and providing emotional support.
  • Kambli announced he is ready to go to rehab and credited his family for their support during his recovery.
  • Several former cricketers have offered Kambli encouragement and support through this difficult period.
"I’m ready to go to rehab. I want to go there because I don’t fear anything. My family is with me." – Vinod Kambli

This article sheds light on the importance of friendship and support systems in overcoming personal health challenges, emphasizing Kambli's journey and resilience.

item.title: Rohit Sharma To Make Brave Selection Calls For Gabba Test? Report Makes Big Claim - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Rohit Sharma To Make Brave Selection Calls For Gabba Test? Report Makes Big Claim

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

India is poised to make significant changes to their playing XI ahead of the third Test against Australia at the Gabba, Brisbane.

  • Veteran spinner Ravichandran Ashwin may be replaced by Washington Sundar.
  • Pacer Akash Deep could come in for Harshit Rana, depending on the pitch conditions.
  • Josh Hazlewood returns to Australia’s side for the Gabba Test after missing the previous game.
  • India's predicted XI includes big names like Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Jasprit Bumrah.
“Rana returned figures of 3/48 and 1/69 on his debut in Perth, before going wicketless across both innings in Adelaide.”

With the Gabba's pitch likely favoring fast bowlers, these selection changes may be crucial for India's performance against Australia.

item.title: ‘I’m not here to please everyone. I’m here to win games for Australia’: Marnus Labuschagne takes aim at David Warner’s ‘lack of awareness’ comment - The Indian Express
item.description:
I’m not here to please everyone. I’m here to win games for Australia’: Marnus Labuschagne takes aim at David Warner’s ‘lack of awareness’ comment

Publication Date: December 6, 2024

Source: The Indian Express

Marnus Labuschagne has responded to former Australian opener David Warner's critiques regarding his batting performance during the Border Gavaskar Trophy against India. Labuschagne defended his actions and expressed confidence in his abilities.

  • David Warner criticized Labuschagne’s batting for lacking awareness during the Test series.
  • Labuschagne questioned Warner's comments, highlighting his historical performance regarding being caught at gully.
  • In response, Labuschagne emphasized his intent to play naturally and win games for Australia.
  • Labuschagne scored 64 in the second Test, contributing to Australia's series equalization.
“At the end of the day, I’m not here to please everyone. I’m here to win games for Australia.”

Labuschagne’s remarks highlight his determination to perform and disregard external criticism as he aims to lead his team to victory.

item.title: Ajinkya Rahane blasts 5 sixes, 11 fours, doesn't even spare Hardik Pandya; smashes hat-trick of 50s, sets SMAT on fire - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ajinkya Rahane blasts 5 sixes, 11 fours, doesn't even spare Hardik Pandya; smashes hat-trick of 50s, sets SMAT on fire

Publication Date: Dec 13, 2024 08:01 PM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

Ajinkya Rahane produced a stunning performance, scoring 98 off 56 balls, leading Mumbai into the final of the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy.

  • Rahane hit 11 fours and 5 sixes to chase down a 159-run target against Baroda.
  • This innings was his third consecutive half-century, following scores of 95 and 84 in previous matches.
  • He is currently the highest run-scorer of the 2024/25 SMAT with 432 runs across 7 innings.
  • In his innings, he shared an 88-run partnership with Shreyas Iyer, who scored 46 runs.
  • Rahane's form is a positive sign for his IPL team, Kolkata Knight Riders, who acquired him for ₹1.5 crore.
"The message from them was clear: go out there and play your natural game," Rahane said after the match.

Rahane’s consistent performances and leadership are proving vital for Mumbai as they aim for the championship in the ongoing tournament.

item.title: ICC Champions Trophy 2025: Hybrid model gets go ahead as Pakistan to play World Cup 2026 Group Matches in Colombo - myKhel
item.description:
ICC Champions Trophy 2025: Hybrid model gets go ahead as Pakistan to play World Cup 2026 Group Matches in Colo.

Published: Friday, December 13, 2024, 19:56 [IST] Source: MyKhel

The International Cricket Council (ICC) has approved a hybrid model for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025, allowing matches to be played in both Pakistan and Dubai, addressing logistical challenges between Pakistan and India.

  • Ten matches will be hosted in Pakistan, including group-stage games.
  • India's three league-stage matches will be held in Dubai, including the India-Pakistan match.
  • Semifinals and the final will take place in Dubai.
  • Pakistan will not travel to India for the 2026 ICC Men's T20 World Cup, with matches in Colombo instead.
  • Pakistan secures the right to host an ICC Women's tournament after 2027.
“The decision to adopt the hybrid hosting model for the Champions Trophy 2025 is seen as a compromise that allows both Pakistan and India to participate in the event while addressing sensitive issues related to travel and political tensions.”

This innovative approach reflects a pragmatic shift in international cricket, with stakeholders working towards smooth operations of major tournaments despite political hurdles.

item.title: Jamie Overton to Sherfane Rutherford: 5 IPL 2025 stars you need to watch in BBL - India.com
item.description:
Jamie Overton to Sherfane Rutherford: 5 IPL 2025 stars you need to watch in BBL

Publication Date: October 12, 2023 | Source: India.com

The BBL 2024-25 season is set to feature exciting future IPL stars. Watch out for these talented players making waves in the league, as their performances could secure them major IPL contracts for the 2025 season.

  • Jake Fraser-McGurk: Aggressive opener signed by Delhi Capitals for INR 9 crores, known for his explosive batting.
  • Xavier Bartlett: Brisbane Heat seamer who took 20 wickets last season, picked by Punjab Kings for INR 80 lakh.
  • Sherfane Rutherford: In form against Bangladesh and joining Sydney Thunder, aims to impress in IPL 2025 with Gujarat Titans.
  • Jamie Overton: English all-rounder joining Adelaide Strikers with a strong performance in wickets from the last season.

"It's a great opportunity for these players to showcase their skills in the BBL and potentially secure IPL contracts for the upcoming season," said a sports analyst.

As the BBL season unfolds, fans should keep an eye on these rising stars, whose performances could shape their careers in the IPL.
